website_summaries.verdict: Ranks high for its reliability and durability, even when tossed around in the boat or on a pier.
pros: Endorsed by professional and experienced fishers across the world
Aluminum oxide guide inserts, graphite blank construction, quality-grade fore and rear cork grips, and stainless steel hooded reel seats
cons: Some claim it's not as durable as advertised

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: I own just about ever length of these Okuma trout rods. I have only fished for trout on rivers and small lakes with these and they hold up very well. The action is one of the best I have used over the past 40 years of trout fishing. I have not broken one yet, the guys that have broken them catching bass are jerking so hard to set the hook maybe they need to use a medium/heavy action rod. These are ultra-light. 6'-6" perfect length if you were only on planning on one.
customer_reviews.author: C Holliman

customer_reviews.title: ... the 7’6” for a year now and it’s my favorite rod I use almost every time
customer_reviews.text: Owned the 7’6” for a year now and it’s my favorite rod I use almost every time. Super fun rod with enough backbone to land good size American Shad and smaller steelhead easily but still sensitive and soft enough for panfish. Recently ordered the 8’6” because I like my 7’6” so much.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph La Rossa

customer_reviews.title: A nice rod!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this rod, and an Okuma reel for trout fishing. Since I only fish for trout about twice a year, I didn't want to spend a ton of money. I was pleased with the action and the sensitivity on my last outing, and now I find I'm enjoying using it for my panfish rod. Perhaps I'm not the most sophisticated angler, but this rod suits my needs just fine. Put some two pound test on your reel, and this rod does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: PirateMike

customer_reviews.title: I don't see how you can beat the price to quality ratio
customer_reviews.text: I used the rod for a day at my local lake and it performed really well. 8/10 on sensitivity and has a good ratio of flexibility to stiffness. Caught a 17" and 16" rainbow trout and the rod handle them perfectly. I don't see how you can beat the price to quality ratio. I bought the 5'6" rod and paired it with a sienna 500F with 2lb fluorocarbon leader and 6lb braid.
customer_reviews.author: MERMAN CHAMP

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a great rod but better if Amazon used a bigger box
customer_reviews.text: This was to be my second Okuma rod, to be used for crappie and perch fishing next spring and summer. It’s super lightweight and perfect for that purpose. Unfortunately, Amazon thought it would be a good idea to ship it to me in a box that was about 3” shorter than the rod. Consequently, that’s how much of the tip that was broken off when received. A replacement has been ordered and this one will be picked up tomorrow by UPS. As far as durability is concerned, I’ll revise as appropriate when an unbroken rod arrives.
customer_reviews.author: R. Darrington

customer_reviews.title: Great Rod for the $$
customer_reviews.text: I have the 5'6" version of this rod paired with a Field and Stream Ravenna 10 reel. And what can I say it's been a great rod, I've landed probably 30 trout with it this season and the largest fish I've personally landed was a 20 in rainbow. The photo is a small 10 in rainbow I caught last weekend.
customer_reviews.author: JSwPa

customer_reviews.title: My #1 go-to stream kayak setup
customer_reviews.text: Okuma products are great! This is my second purchase of this same rod. I loved my first one so much, I bought a second one. These are my #1 rods for stream smallmouth kayak fishing. This rod gives me just the right amount of tip action & feel for the strike, & combines plenty of power to reel them in. I only use 6 lb. & 4 lb. test on these, anything heavier, you should use a larger rod. I use a Shimano Sienna 500 reel on one setup, & a Lew's LaserLite Speed Spool reel on the other. I've got rods that cost 2-3 times as much as this Celilo, & this rod is by far the best.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: My new go to for ultra light rods 😎
customer_reviews.text: I put this pole to the test and it past with flying colors. It's good-looking it's durable the quality is really good considering the price. I actually like this more than my Shimano ultralight rod 😲. With 6lb line it casts forever and I need to feather the line to keep from overshooting my target area. Slayed 6 feisty and decent size rainbow trout today with no problems and had enough backbone to set the hook solid and even lift them up out of the water.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Tough little rod
customer_reviews.text: This ultralight rod and 8lb Seagar fluorocarbon pulled an 18ft bass boat with 3 anglers against a breeze for about 20 yards to free a hung-up jig and held up great. I mean, it was torqued. I read a comment before purchasing that said all their 6 ft and under rods are one-piece. This is a 6ft 2-piece. It is still extremely strong. I like fishing with light tackle. For $24, I may buy another.
customer_reviews.author: jake s

customer_reviews.title: It's is awesome 8'6 ultralight rod
customer_reviews.text: I first bought this to trout fishing, yo castsome spoon,then i used for squiding Hyannis squids which are about half to 1 lb each squids, awesome action awesome rod bend, its ridiculously flex but due to lenth of the rod its give you better control n less fatigue than shorter medium rod I jigged 1-2 oz for squid n cast about 15-20 yards from boat for squid
customer_reviews.author: Nina Tran

customer_reviews.title: Overall glad I bought this at this price.
customer_reviews.text: Really love this rod. I trust Okuma and with every product purchased I've never been let down. The rod it self caught a few trout. The action is more of a medium so maybe not as sensitive as other ultralights I have and a bit more "whippy". But paired with a pflueger president and mono line it works well. The packaging itself could definitely be improved so I definitely would say make sure your rod is not to bent and everything else looks well before use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken, poor quality, poor service
customer_reviews.text: Rod arrived damaged. New replacement was sent out. Update: A second rod was sent out. After a short while the ceramic ring fell out of one of the guides. Okuma warranty wants payment that is equivalent to the price of a brand new rod to do anything about it. If you like poor quality and terrible service purchase Okuma. Will be buying Daiwa from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Customer McCustomerface

customer_reviews.title: Tip broke off after only a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this rod in July 2018 and only fished with it maybe 4 times. In October 2018, the tip broke off while I was reeling in a 2 pound fish. While Okuma has offered to replace the top of the rod, the are going to charge $15.00 for shipping, almost half what a new rod costs.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W. Torrance

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, I think...
customer_reviews.text: I never used this brand of pole. But for the money I didn't have much to lose. Will I buy it again, maybe not. This is a review with out actually using it. So take it with a grain of salt. The only reason I gave it four stars is the handle. The cork handle is so thick. And the actual rod is very small. So I'm not enjoying those aesthetics of the pole. But I will rewrite a review when I take it out for panfish.
customer_reviews.author: PnwFishingOutlaw

customer_reviews.title: Great Ultralight Rod
customer_reviews.text: I have caught countless bluegill, sunfish, bass, and catfish with this rod. I have it paired with a 1000 sized reel and it makes every fish (even little bluegill) feel like a trophy bass when they fight. It is light, pretty sensitive, and breaks down into 2 pieces so it fits in the back of my car taking up virtually no space. If you are looking for a reliable pond fishing rod for an adult or child than look no further. You won't be disappointed in it's performance for its price.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great rod at twice the price.
customer_reviews.text: Have lots of expensive freshwater and saltwater fishing poles. This is probably the cheapest of all of them. Credibly happy with it especially for the price. Got the 5 foot ultralight version and used it on a recent trip to Yellowstone. Caught lots of trout at the Buffalo Bill State Park in Cody Wyoming and was extremely pleased with it’s performance in casting small lures and fighting fish.
customer_reviews.author: Carlisle

customer_reviews.title: Great rod for price.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic rod for the price. Good feel, good touch. I use this for river small mouth bass in northern NC, where a 3lb fish is huge. Also use for mountain trout fishing. Good deal, love this rod. Have it paired with a 1000 size spinning reel from Lew's, and it's a quality package.
customer_reviews.author: TheMoose

customer_reviews.title: Great for trout and Crappie
customer_reviews.text: I like this rod I got it for crappie and trout. Running 8lb mono on it. throwing a split-shot and worm works well. This thing is super sensitive and will send out that small 1/4 spinnerbaits well. The cork came in coming off in places. Also 'the tip is so tiny and frail you can start seeing a lot of wear. Also its a bit heavier than expected but maybe its because I have an 86.
customer_reviews.author: RDS

customer_reviews.title: Came snapped in half
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this rod and waited weeks for it. I was supper excited and as reviews said i ordered it alone so it wouldnt be damaged by other products. When i recieved my package the rod was snapped in half but it was packaged well so i honestly feel like it was broken before placed in the box. I dont see how it could of broke but now i have to send it back and hope i get a refund after leaving this review. Just go buy it in person.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!
customer_reviews.text: As a frequent Amazon user, this is the first product that is disappointing, due to SERIOUS MIS-REPRESENTATION. What I ordered was a 6'6" lightweight spinning rod, Okuma model # CE-S-662UL-1. What I received in the mail today, 3/27/20 was a 6' rod with the tip broken off. As any fisherman knows, the tip is the most important part of the rod. I expect a full refund, immediately! If not, I will register more formal complaints, until this issue is made right, believe me. No way to do business! Thank you for receiving this initial complaint. I expect immediate results, to put this matter to rest. If not, I assure you, I will proceed further.
customer_reviews.author: A VERY DISAPPOINTED CUSTOMER

customer_reviews.title: Horrible rod
customer_reviews.text: Absolute crap rod. Snapped under the 3rd eye with way less than a pounds worth of pressure. Take warning don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Cairo

customer_reviews.title: Be nice to the guide inserts and you’re golden.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a cheap setup for throwing light lures and for fishing creeks. I fish this with a little Shakespeare Agility spinning reel, and it has been a blast. However, the rod tip broke within about a month of having it. Okuma would charge $25 just to send a new rod tip. No worries though. I ordered a rod tip through another site. I am thinking of buying another rod to set up for one of my nephews. They are just good fun.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Snow

customer_reviews.title: Sensitivity and cast are great.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a replacement rod for a broken ultralight. The sensitivity of this 5’6” rod is great. The cast is great. As ultralight goes, this is a really good value. I don’t know if I’d trust it pulling in a 15lber, but it is wonderful for trout and panfish and makes fighting a 2-3 lb fish feel like a monster. Really good quality rod.
customer_reviews.author: mrg923

customer_reviews.title: I really liked this rod, however.
customer_reviews.text: I used this rod half a day trout fishing, I had an ultra light reel on it, I went to put it in the trunk of my car, grabbed it about mid ways and went to lift it and it broke like a match stick, hardly any pressure on bending it, actually I would say no pressure. It just snapped. I really liked it, more so than the ultra light Ugly Stick I also had with me, I'll stick with the Ugly Sticks from now on
customer_reviews.author: rh38

customer_reviews.title: Really nice entry level UL rod
customer_reviews.text: My first UL rod, I decided to look for a cheap rod to test instead of dishing out the benjamin. I've heard the celilo was a really good rod for the money, though having not caught my first trout yet it's a really lightweight rod that I have paired with a shimano 500 size reel. I haven't tested the whole lure range out but I was throwing a 1/4oz kastmaster on 6lb fluoro and it slings well.
customer_reviews.author: Koda N.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Update: been using this pole for a year now. I’ve caught huge trouts with it. I even started fishing for stripers too. It’s definitely a great rod. This rod definitely looks and feels fragile. I am not sure how it’s going to handle a 5lb trout but we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: yang408

customer_reviews.title: 8'6" ultra-fun
customer_reviews.text: Had to have one in 8'6" after trying my son's while we were river fishing for American Shad. Nice ultralight for my needs/wants.... allow me to toss 1/32oz ball head jig with 1" grubs & a split shot further than the 7' I'm used to. For the price, quality is pretty good. Action not to soft/moderate in the lower-mid section which is what I desire. Should be fun later in the season when the 5-pounders+ arrive. All catch & release fun.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: My new go to trout rod!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the UL 5’6 for a trip to the kern river and man did it not disappoint. Caught a 13 inch rainbow and the action on the rod was great! Handled it very well in the the strong current. I can feel the slightest nibble and the rod being short I can get through dense wooded forest. Will buy another in 6’6 cus you can’t beat the price for the rod. Paired it with shimano sienna FG 1000 and makes a great setup.
customer_reviews.author: Jair Langarica

customer_reviews.title: I like them enough, to give as a gift
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered a third one of these for my son's birthday. I have both the 6'6", and the 5' and both are great rods for the money. Are they St. Croixs? No, but they aren't as much money either. They cast very well, and are super sensitive. For under $30, you can't go wrong. I usually carry two rods fishing, one is a St. Croix, the other is an Okuma Celilo. One word of caution on very sensitive rods, be very careful of the tips, and don't set the hook super hard, or you'll rip the fishes lips off :-)
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M. Goen

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and value
customer_reviews.text: This is made for 2-6 lb. mono, excellent for price. Very light, good quality and perfect for inexpensive pan fish rod or light lures. Seems to be a bargain, hope it holds up as well as several of their spinning rods I have used for several years. Tosses 1/8 oz.jigs good distance.bought for young beginner, hard to give up.
customer_reviews.author: M. Belken

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed with the rod. The ceramic ring in the top ring was broken when it arrived and kept slicing my line . As soon as I grabbed the rod to check what the problem was it broke. The rod was extremely brittle like it was a factory defect rod that was sent out. The rod tip kept breaking haven’t used it since
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Ultralight Rod
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this rod for several weeks now. It has held up well. I paired it with the smallest Phlueger reel they make. I’ve caught all the popular species of fish here in southern Kentucky. Have even caught several nice sized catfish, though not targeting them at the time.
customer_reviews.author: Big McLargeHuge

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value...great performance
customer_reviews.text: First day fishing with the 5' 2-piece rod, and I caught 3 brown trout over 13" and the biggest 19", 2 3/4 pounds. Performed flawlessly and handled these fish very well. Highly recommended. Paired it with an Okuma Stratus VI Size 10, 6 ounce reel for a nice light rod reel combo.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bjorkman

customer_reviews.title: Well made, well balanced rod!
customer_reviews.text: I fish from a kayak and the shorter rods just don't work well because you are low to the waterline. With the extra length, you have more control and you can case longer.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba buck

customer_reviews.title: Found an excellent replacement
customer_reviews.text: My old rod broke after 10 years or so. I have been looking for a replacement and found this one that is just as good or superior to my old reliable. Excellent action on this ultralight. I fish inland streams for trout and this one responds delightfully.
customer_reviews.author: kmr

customer_reviews.title: Think "surf rod for trout..."
customer_reviews.text: The pic should tell it all. 21 1/2 inch brown trout, first blood on the Celilo. 2 lb. test, 1/6 oz. rainbow trout finish Thomas Buoyant. Did a superb job, most pleased. Closest thing to an issue is the reel seat being mounted upside down, so the threads are under my index finger during use. Still, it casts a country mile, does well with light lines, good feel overall.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID W SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Decent rod for the money
customer_reviews.text: Mine showed up in perfect shape. I had read some other reviews about the packaging, mine showed up in good shape in oversized box. The rod itself seems great for the money. I will buy another one
customer_reviews.author: Joe K.

customer_reviews.title: Not all fishing rods are created equal!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite fishing rods and I absolutely love it, in fact I have two! I use them almost exclusively for crappies. This rod has nice soft action at the tip but enough backbone to set hooks. Some ultra light rods are whippy their entire length-not this one. At 6'6" you're in control, not only fishing, but transporting this 2 piece beauty. Ceramic ferrules and a hook keeper completes one of the finest fishing rods at a great price. I will continue to recommend this rod to all my fishing friends. Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bittorf

customer_reviews.title: Love the light action
customer_reviews.text: Love the light action. Which is just what I was looking for. I feel like it is a good value for the money. So far so good and the construction seems solid. Others complained about the durability but has not been an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: It's a kick!
customer_reviews.text: I use this rod for Crappie and perch and love it. It's a great match for small fish / light line fishing yet works amazingly well when the occasional 3lb Smallie hits.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good rods
customer_reviews.text: GREAT rods. Bought 2 and both are quality. Great feel of the lure/fish. The reel seat is plastic but it holds a 500 or 1000 series firm... i paired mine with ardent reels..
customer_reviews.author: Nieandermeiers

customer_reviews.title: Love this weapon for bait fish and pan fries.
customer_reviews.text: It's a flimsy pole. It's like a noodle. Not really a strong hauler but I've picked up a 4# trevally with this stick on the first day. I paired it with my daiwa revros lt 2500 xh spinner, lined with 4# test mono. Also great with daiwa 3000 battle 2 lined with 6# test mono. Great reaction and feel, not the strongest back bone but she holds out. I'd buy this again if I broke mine.
customer_reviews.author: Kyton K.

customer_reviews.title: Nice rod for your money!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the 5'6" 2pc UL rod for a couple of years now and it is a solid rod! It is light weight, durable, has ceramic guides and good action, sensitive (meaning you can feel even light strikes with this rod). It has met or exceeded all of my expectations for a nice rod. I paid around $20 for it so feel it is a good value for my money and has held up well and I am still using it. Great purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne G.

customer_reviews.title: BROKEN EASILY
customer_reviews.text: First round of fishing with the celilo and the tip broke off, not a clean snap but a fracture and a thumb. I'm not sure if the product was damaged during transportation or it's simply too weak. Was running a ultralight setup as intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Hanfei Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Okuma quality and price
customer_reviews.text: True, shipping could be better, but this is a great rod. Use it within its intended means, stay within the line/lure rating, and you'll have a fun time on the lake or at the stream! Or you can complain how it broke for no reason when you were actually throwing 1oz lures and not setting your drag properly.
customer_reviews.author: Rayzor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome trout rod!
customer_reviews.text: I use it in the Smokies for trout. Used it three times already coupled with an Alaris 20 reel. Spooled with 4lb spiderwire mono and 6lb flourocarbon leader. Su k a lightweight smooth but strong trout rig.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M

customer_reviews.title: A very nice rod.
customer_reviews.text: A very nice rod. I got the 5’ two piece ultra light rod. This rod is paired with a pfluger president 20. It’s perfect for trout and panfish. Is holding up very well even after several large trout.
customer_reviews.author: Snapshooter

customer_reviews.title: Very nice rod!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this rod, I have two now and another one broken by car window because i wasn’t careful. This is very good rod and i am saying it with the experience of having used st croix panfish rod and avid for long time.
customer_reviews.author: jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase - good value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a back up to my Okuma SST 702 UL. I tested this rod on a trip to the High Sierra Nevada Lakes for some trout. I caught lots of fish from the shore and it casts really far. I ran 4# mono it is a solid rod you wont be dissapointed. I recommend also taking a look at the SST models for the enthusiasts!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Day

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a 1 piece rod
customer_reviews.text: The rod seems well make but the model # indicates its a 1 piece rod where its 2 piece, its still worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: lowerbama

customer_reviews.title: A Great Twenty-Something Dollar Rod
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of backcountry fishing in the Sierra Nevadas. I have broken many a rods while ducking under a fallen tree or low hanging branch, or while dropping a pack. I am reticent to spend too much on a rod. This one has performed admirably over the last summer. Using 2 lb. test and a moderately broad range of trout sized lures, it has casted very well. The action is very nice for setting the hook. Moreover, the real cork has a great feel.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Break easy
customer_reviews.text: The tip of the pole breaks easy without any abuse. I bought 3 and they all did the same thing break at the top on end of pole.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Great budget trout rod.
customer_reviews.text: Great budget trout rod. Got one for each of my boys. These are light and very sensitive but with great backbone to hold a trout in the current.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A Fileccia

customer_reviews.title: This rod is fun for trout !
customer_reviews.text: I love this pole. The ultra light feels like a light, and isn’t overly noodly. For the money to get a comfy cork handle can’t go wrong. Paired with a President feel pretty sweet setup for under $75.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey D

customer_reviews.title: ultralite. Built. Like anything else light you dont abuse it
customer_reviews.text: Bought 1 for my son and 1 for a fishing buddy because he only uses 7 ft poles for trout and wanted to get him into fun fishing with ultralites. They both love them.
customer_reviews.author: Jim hartman

customer_reviews.title: I love this rod
customer_reviews.text: I love this rod. Growing up, I never imagined such a small, lightweight rod (and reels to match) would exist one day. Gone is the precious fishing time lost while untangling line from overhead branches, etc. It's also a pretty accurate caster, very nimble, looks great, and I love it. Fogdog Sports did a great job packing the rod in a very ample, heavyweight tube, no chance of the rod getting broken in shipping. Also, they shipped much faster than they promised. Seems like a great company.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Shakey

customer_reviews.title: Seems well built
customer_reviews.text: If it quits raining and the river gets low enough I might be able to go test this out
customer_reviews.author: Matt Creed

customer_reviews.title: Good rod
customer_reviews.text: Very good rod for small trout and sun fish but no good for big fish like 3lb and up my snap with a 20 inch trout. I was lucky enough no to lose that fish as my friend scoop up with a net.
customer_reviews.author: Juan munoz Cruz

customer_reviews.title: LIght and sensative
customer_reviews.text: Nice light rod, very sensitive. Fast action and has enough backbone to get the hook set. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: gil walker

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Nice little ultralight trout rod especially for the price. Now on the other side of it I ordered 2 rods and got 1-1/2. How in the heck does some genius ship 1/2 of a fishing pole??? So returned the 1/2 a pole and will put the other work.
customer_reviews.author: buttermybisquits

customer_reviews.title: Okuma Celilo 6-6 Ultralight
customer_reviews.text: This rod rocks. The construction is very professional, beautiful finish/ color, nice cork handle. I found the guides to be in perfect line. This thing was a blast in the Eastern Sierras and performs great for our bass/ bluegill down here in SoCal, especially repeated casting of spinners. The rod is light and sensitive, pair it with an ultralight reel like the Okuma Avenger (size 15) and you will be in business. Highly Recommended, I would gladly buy again.
customer_reviews.author: socaloutdoors

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Very nice rod. I like the cork handles and it is a well built rod.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good UL rod for the money
customer_reviews.text: Would have given 5 stars if the fastener for your reel didnt feel like I could break it. Hoping it doesn't give me problems in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Gallant

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Not going to compare it to my very expensive rods, because that isn't fair. Not the best rods in the world. But for the price, Im not sure what else you can expect. I took them fishing across New Mexico and they did great!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Newman

customer_reviews.title: Very nice ultralight spinning rod
customer_reviews.text: Great rod for the price. I've been using it this spring as my primary rod and am very happy with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: dshellpsu

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with the 8'6'' Ultra Light
customer_reviews.text: The length and action enable good casting distance with light lures, the tip is very sensitive to subtle bites, and it's a sturdy rod. I've caught hard-fighting 2 to 4 lb Lake Crowley trout that dive under the boat and bend the rod into nearly a full "U" and I was really surprised the rod didn't break. Good value -- performs as well as some other rods that cost me twice as much.
customer_reviews.author: Socal Refugee

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed so far.
customer_reviews.text: Excited to receive pole. One of my favorite you tube creators strongly recommends this pole. So I was ready to try it out. But then I opened the box and man missing half the pole then when I looked at what I did get completely crushed! Bummer. Returned. And hopefully the replacement at least gets to me.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great rod
customer_reviews.text: Great rod for my back yard pond. Caught a few 2-3lb bass on it no problem. Might have an issues with some bigger bass. Super light weight and flexible and casts great because of it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Corey

customer_reviews.title: Solid Performance
customer_reviews.text: So far this is a solid light action rod. Nice casting distance with 1/32 jigs!
customer_reviews.author: Jwezell

customer_reviews.title: The best rods I use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these rods 2 years ago. I fish 80 to 100 days a year. I use these rods all the time. I've caught large fish on these. I mostly fish for crappie bluegills and walleye. These rods are great. They handle any fish I catch with ease. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Danny Evans

customer_reviews.title: Love this rod
customer_reviews.text: Used my ice fishing reel on the rod. This ultra-light is a lot of fun. A 8" Gill is a lot of fun to catch. I bought the 6-foot model. Construction seems to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: lou

customer_reviews.title: Broke it on a 15 pound carp
customer_reviews.text: Love this rod!!!! Paired it with a Okuma spa 10 spinning real was Crappie fishing and hooked a 15 pound Carp and before I could cut the line snapped the pole off. So I ordered me a new Okuma rod. I love the action on this rod it’s amazing.
customer_reviews.author: C.W.

customer_reviews.title: Not that durable... Be gentle with it...
customer_reviews.text: Was performing okay... Caught a few bass on it.... Broke the tip affer 2 months of fishing about 5 to 8 hours a week.... It was okay but just not as durable as i thought.... I will get the ugly stick next althoug i already have a fenwick eagle spin on order...
customer_reviews.author: Alex ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Good trout rod
customer_reviews.text: This is my first true trout rod and I love it. Can feel the smallest nibble
customer_reviews.author: jillian

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Best rod I've owned for small fish. After owning for a year and fishing with this a lot I still absalutely love this rod, but I must say, dont whip this little short rod too hard because I did and I scout a treble hook to the back of the head. XD
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Sexton

customer_reviews.title: Great Rod Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I chose the 5'6" model for river trout. Good sensitivity and sturdy construction. I have hiked through heavy brush with it on a number of occasions and have never been worried about it breaking when caught on a branch. Casts well. Great rod, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: This Rod is great for pan fishing, trout fishing or crappie fishing
customer_reviews.text: Rod exceeded my expectations when crappie fishing. Great rod good sensitivity and feel. Got the 8ft6in Rod which is a two-piece. Ended up hanging into a 4 lb Channel cat and it held up great.
customer_reviews.author: supermom724

customer_reviews.title: Love this rod
customer_reviews.text: Love this rod. Ultra light rod that is useful for those tight spaces in the mountains. I have had it for about a year and it is still like i bought it yesterday. Need a rod like this for trout fishing that allows you to feel every movement and nibble.
customer_reviews.author: G Peralta

customer_reviews.title: Love this rod
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality for the price. Absolutely one of my best and favorite rods. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: R.Lee Sannes

customer_reviews.title: Great rod at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a light spinning rod for the rare occasions that I don't use a fly rod. I don't know how Okuma can sell such a nicely made rod at such a low price. Slave labor? It is a very nice rod and performs well for small stream fishing with light lures. No case or bag, but the price is right!
customer_reviews.author: MacReviewsStuff

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rod for the money! Nearly loomis quality for a fraction of the price!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Hornung

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose!
customer_reviews.text: Rod has a nice action and is responsive. Not a big fan of the plastic nuts used on the reel seat, but I haven't seen a metal nut in a few years
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like the rod. 8.5 feet, sensitive and around 45$ The finish on the guides (flexcoat) is sloppy. I've used mine for throwing mini-jigs for trout & have caught many fish already. This rod with a split grip & nice finish work would be outstanding...
customer_reviews.author: sean bradley

customer_reviews.title: Good rod for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Good rod for the money. Light weight with very good UL action.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey coggins

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Well built fun rod. Great for fishing ponds on my property.
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: awesome for the money, caught many panfish with this already, even a small northern by accident. action feels responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Ron W

customer_reviews.title: Great little rod.
customer_reviews.text: If you fish trout small streams in the Appalachians, this rod is the ticket. To me, five feet is the ideal length in this neck of the wood and the action of this rod is just about right. I've paid over $100 for similar rods and this one is a real value at the amazon price. If you break it, just order another.
customer_reviews.author: rowantree

customer_reviews.title: This is not a complete rod.
customer_reviews.text: Says in the listing that this is a two piece rod but all you get is the butt section. Thought it was a packaging error and returned it only to receive another butt section in the next package. Hard to fish with half a rod.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Cracked above the handle
customer_reviews.text: I have used my rod a few times and have had it 10 months. Today I went to set the hook on a fish and the rod snapped off just above the handle. The person fishing with me watched it happen and said he did not think I put too much stress on it. I did not feel a lot of stress either.. Not sure if i should order another one or just move on to another rod
customer_reviews.author: Tim & Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Very fragile
customer_reviews.text: Broke the first time I used it. Unfortunately it was after my return period With Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Quincy C.

customer_reviews.title: OKUMA awesome pole
customer_reviews.text: Love this rod. Great for trout! Can't wait to test it out this weekend
customer_reviews.author: Alex/Kathy Sieu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for light weight fishing
customer_reviews.text: Great rod for light gear fishing (i.e. stream trout, etc.). This is my second purchase of this rod. If I need another I will do it again.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: The real MVP
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome!! Very nice and light works like a charm!! Thinking about buying another. Can feel every hit or bite on the line.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This has become my favorite light fishing rod, I enjoy it so much I ordered more of different lengths. Absolutely love catching trout, up to 23 inches, with this rod.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: End broke off while setting up first time. Never got to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm not disappointed. The cork handle is really nice too
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a rod that I have been using for 20 years. I'm not disappointed. The cork handle is really nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Bunky6765

customer_reviews.title: broke after a few trips. not worth repair.
customer_reviews.text: used it a few times and the tip broke off. did not take on any oversized fish, so I'm disappointed it didn't stand up to normal use.
customer_reviews.author: itsborken

customer_reviews.title: My favorite rod
customer_reviews.text: Great rod at a great price. I went with the 8'6" ultralight and its my favorite rod. Very sensitive and durable to this point. No complaints from me. Wish I would have bought two because when I go fishing with my girlfriend she always steals this and I'm stuck with a medium ugly stick and its just not the same.
customer_reviews.author: Derf Diggler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite rods. When I had an issue the company stood behind the product 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Great rods for the money
customer_reviews.text: Have a 6'6" and a 8'6'. Use on everything from brook trout to pike. Great rods for the money.
customer_reviews.author: foxfire

product_meta.title: OKUMA Celilo Graphite Lightweight Ultra Light Trout Rods
product_meta.description: The fisheries of the Northeast and Northwest have been in turmout to say the least. However the future looks bright. The lake trout have come back strong in the last few years and the Northwest rivers are seeing the strongest runs of salmon and steelhead in recent history. With input from some of the top fishermen on these waters we developed the Celilo series. Throwing modesty out the window we nailed these actions and developed the perfect salmon, trout and bottom bouncing graphite rods. Although beautiful, you don't have to take out that second mortgage to load the boat with them.
feature_bullets: Standard pipe reel seat with short cork
